items.title: Trump says there will be 'hell to pay' if Hamas fails to disarm
items.description: The US president has been hosting Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at his residence in Florida for talks on Gaza and several other issues.

items.title: Trump warns Iran against rebuilding nuclear program

featured_image.name: Trump says US would back strikes against Iran’s missile programme

items.description:
President Donald Trump threatened renewed military action against Iran on Monday if Tehran attempts to rebuild its nuclear capabilities, declaring the United States would "knock the hell out of them" during a meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago[1][2][3].

Speaking alongside Netanyahu, Trump claimed joint U.S.-Israeli operations had already destroyed Iran's nuclear program and fundamentally shifted the Middle East balance of power. "We just won a big war together," Trump said. "If we didn't beat Iran, you wouldn't have had peace in the Middle East. We wiped it out"[1][3].

When pressed on whether he would support further Israeli military strikes if Iran continues advancing its missile or nuclear programs, Trump responded affirmatively. "If they continue with the missiles — yes," he said. "The nuclear — absolutely"[1][2][3].

items.title: Jessica could have a cochlear implant but decided not to. Here's why
items.description: Cochlear implants can be a life-changing tool for people with hearing loss, but some Deaf people argue their use risks compromising their community's identity.

items.title: Kazakhstan oil output falls 6% after Ukraine hits Russia export terminal

featured_image.name: Kazakhstan tells Ukraine to stop attacking CPC terminal after oil exports halted

items.description:
Kazakhstan's oil production fell approximately 6 percent in December following a Ukrainian drone strike that crippled a critical Russian export terminal, forcing the Central Asian nation to scramble for alternative export routes and threatening billions in revenue[1][2].

The country's oil and gas condensate output dropped to 1.93 million barrels per day between December 1 and 28, down from November averages, according to an industry source cited by Reuters [1][2]. Production at the Chevron-operated Tengiz oilfield, Kazakhstan's largest, plummeted 10 percent to 719,800 barrels per day during the same period[1][2].

items.title: Trump says US 'knocked out' a 'big facility' in Venezuela
items.description: A US strike on Venezuelan soil would be the first known land attack in the country since the Trump administration began ratcheting up pressure on its ruling regime, which Donald Trump accuses of "narco-terrorism".

items.title: China launches major drills around Taiwan after record US arms sale

featured_image.name: China stages record drills designed to encircle Taiwan

items.description:
China commenced its largest military exercises around Taiwan on Monday, deploying army, navy, air force and rocket units in what Beijing characterized as a "stern warning" following the Trump administration's approval of a record $11.1 billion arms package to the self-governed island earlier this month.

The "Justice Mission 2025" exercises mark the sixth major round of drills since 2022 and involve live-fire operations across seven zones surrounding Taiwan, simulating blockades of key ports and strikes on land and maritime targets[1][2][3]. Senior Colonel Shi Yi of the People's Liberation Army's Eastern Theater Command said the drills target "Taiwan independence separatist forces and external interference"[1][4][5][6][7].

items.title: Putin tells Trump peace talks under review after alleged drone attack on residence

featured_image.name: 'Complete fabrication': Zelenskyy denies attack on Putin residence ...

items.description:
Russian President Vladimir Putin told US President Donald Trump on Monday that Russia would review its position in peace negotiations after alleging Ukraine launched a drone attack on his residence, a claim Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy immediately dismissed as fabricated[1][2][3][4].

Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov claimed that 91 long-range drones targeted Putin's Valdai residence in Russia's Novgorod region overnight Sunday into Monday, though he said all were intercepted with no casualties or damage[5][2][6][7]. Lavrov warned that "such reckless actions will not go unanswered" and that Moscow had already selected targets for retaliatory strikes[5][8][9].

The timing of Russia's allegation, coming hours after Trump and Zelenskyy met at Mar-a-Lago on Sunday, drew sharp rebuke from Kyiv. "Russia is at it again, using dangerous statements to undermine all achievements of our shared diplomatic efforts with President Trump's team," Zelenskyy wrote on X[10][11][12]. He called the residence attack story "a complete fabrication intended to justify additional attacks against Ukraine, including Kyiv"[10][13][14].

items.title: Trump warns U.S. will back Isreali strikes if Iran rebuilds nukes

featured_image.name: Trump and Netanyahu meeting at Mar-a-Lago to discuss Gaza peace plan

items.description:
President Donald Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at his Mar-a-Lago estate on Monday to discuss the next phase of the Gaza ceasefire, warning that the United States would support military action against Iran if Tehran attempts to rebuild its nuclear or missile programs.

"I am hearing that Iran is attempting to ramp up their activities again, and if that is the case, we will have to take decisive action," Trump told reporters at the Florida resort[1]. "We will take them down. We will hit them hard. But I hope that isn't the case."

When asked whether the U.S. would back Israeli strikes on Iran's missile program, Trump replied: "If they persist with the missiles, yes; regarding the nuclear issue, absolutely, and it will happen swiftly"[1][2].

items.title: Bystanders fight off alleged Melbourne carjacker
items.description: Police are looking for a man who allegedly tried to steal a woman's car in Richmond earlier this year but was foiled by bystanders, including one person wielding a golf club.

items.title: Russia claims Ukraine attacked Putin residence; Zelensky denies

featured_image.name: Zelensky denies Ukraine attacked Putin's residence, accuses ...

items.description:
Russia accused Ukraine of launching a drone strike on President Vladimir Putin's residence on Monday, a claim Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky immediately rejected as a "complete fabrication" designed to derail peace talks with the United States[1][2][3][4][5][6].

Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said Ukraine fired 91 long-range drones at Putin's Valdai residence in the Novgorod region overnight, all of which were intercepted by air defenses with no casualties or damage reported[7][8][9][10]. Lavrov warned that Moscow would "revise its negotiating position" and had already determined targets for "retaliatory strikes"[8][5][11][9][12].

The accusation emerged just one day after Zelensky met with President Donald Trump in Florida to discuss a proposed 20-point peace plan, with both leaders claiming they had reached 90% agreement[13][14][15]. Following Russia's claim, Trump held what the White House described as a "positive" call with Putin, during which the Russian leader briefed the U.S. president on the alleged attack[16][17][5].

items.title: Chinese automakers poised to lead global car sales in 2025

featured_image.name: China's BYD poised to overtake Tesla in 2025 EV sales

items.description:
Chinese car manufacturers are poised to claim the top spot in worldwide vehicle sales for the first time in 2025, ending Japan's dominance that has spanned more than two decades[1]. The historic shift comes as BYD prepares to overtake Tesla in electric vehicle sales, while Chinese brands collectively expand their global footprint through aggressive exports and competitive pricing.

BYD had sold 2.07 million electric vehicles by the end of November 2025, positioning the Shenzhen-based automaker to surpass Tesla as the world's largest EV seller for the year[2][3][4]. Tesla, which delivered 1.22 million battery electric vehicles through the third quarter, is projected to reach approximately 1.65 million units for the full year, marking a 7.7% decline[2][3]. The American automaker's sales received a temporary boost in the third quarter from buyers rushing to claim a $7,500 US tax credit before it expired in September, but analysts forecast fourth-quarter sales will drop to around 449,000 units[3].

items.title: Search for missing Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 to resume

featured_image.name: HUGIN AUV to Ocean Infinity - Kongsberg Maritime

items.description:
The hunt for Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 will recommence on December 30, more than 11 years after the aircraft vanished with 239 people on board, Malaysian authorities announced this month, reigniting hopes that one of aviation's most enduring mysteries may finally be solved[1][2][3].

UK and US-based marine robotics company Ocean Infinity will lead the renewed effort, conducting a 55-day intermittent search of a targeted 15,000-square-kilometer area in the southern Indian Ocean[1][2][4]. The operation will deploy autonomous underwater vehicles capable of reaching depths exceeding 6,000 meters—technology unavailable during earlier search efforts[5][6].

The Boeing 777 disappeared from radar on March 8, 2014, during a routine flight from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing[1][2][4]. The aircraft carried 227 passengers, predominantly Chinese nationals, along with 12 Malaysian crew members[5][2][3]. Military radar later revealed the plane had deviated sharply from its flight path, turning back over northern Malaysia before heading into the Andaman Sea and then southward, after which all contact was lost[5][7][3].

items.title: Zelensky seeks 50-year US security guarantees

featured_image.name: Trump and Zelensky Meet to Iron Out Peace Plan, but Deal Remains Elusive

items.description:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Monday requested US security guarantees lasting up to 50 years, arguing that Ukraine needs longer-term commitments than the 15-year guarantee currently proposed in peace plan discussions with President Donald Trump.

Following their December 28 meeting at Mar-a-Lago, Zelensky told reporters that while draft documents include "strong" US security guarantees for 15 years with the possibility of extension, he pressed Trump to consider a significantly longer timeframe[1][2][3][4]. "I told him that we are already at war and it has been going on for almost 15 years," Zelensky said in a WhatsApp message to journalists, referencing the conflict that began with Russia's 2014 annexation of Crimea and support for separatists in eastern Ukraine[4][5][6]. "I told him that we would really like to consider the possibility of 30, 40, 50 years," he added[1][7][6].

Trump responded that he would "think about" the proposal, according to Zelensky[8][7][9]. The president offered no immediate commitment, though both leaders described the two-hour meeting as productive and suggested progress toward ending the nearly four-year full-scale war.

items.title: Zelenskyy denies attacking Putin's Novgorod home with long-range drones
items.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov says Moscow will review its position on a planned peace deal with Ukraine due to the alleged attack.

items.title: Russia claims Ukraine attacked Putin's residence with 91 drones

featured_image.name: Russia says Ukraine tried to attack Putin's residence so Moscow's negotiating stance will change

items.description:
Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov announced Monday that Ukraine attempted to strike President Vladimir Putin's residence in the Novgorod region with 91 drones, vowing the attack would prompt Moscow to toughen its position in ongoing peace negotiations.

The alleged assault occurred overnight between December 28 and 29, according to Lavrov, who told Russian state news agencies TASS and Interfax that all drones were destroyed by air defenses[1][2][3]. "Such recklessness will not go unanswered," Lavrov said, though he did not specify whether Putin was present at the residence during the incident[1]. Ukraine has not responded to the claims.

The announcement comes one day after U.S. President Donald Trump hosted Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at Mar-a-Lago, where both leaders expressed cautious optimism about reaching a peace deal to end the nearly four-year war. Trump said the parties were "getting a lot closer, maybe very close" to an agreement, while Zelenskyy reported that a 20-point peace plan was "90 percent agreed upon"[4][5].
